intro: Hetaeria lamellata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf hetaeria, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, compound leaves that are often finely divided, giving it a delicate appearance. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Hetaeria lamellata is native to parts of Europe and Asia, where it grows in moist, calcareous soils. It is often found in woodland edges and along stream banks, thriving in temperate climates.
